setting.name: Default View
setting.description: The default view used in the MediaPortal GUI when the plug-in is first opened. Valid options are "list", "thumbs", "largethumbs", and "filmstrip".

setting.name: Click Shows Details
setting.description: Determines behavior when a movie in the movie browser is clicked. If true, the details view appears. If false the movie starts playback.

setting.name: Use Remote Control Filtering
setting.description: Enables the Remote Controle Filter, set to false if you want to use the default mediaportal remote control functionality.

setting.name: Max Actors, Genres, etc. to Display
setting.description: This determines the number of actors, genres, directors, etc to display on the GUI. This applies to all string based list fields.

setting.name: Artwork Loading Delay
setting.description: The number of milliseconds that Moving Pictures waits before it loads new artwork (backdrops and covers) when traversing movies in the GUI. Increasing this value can improve performance if you are experiencing slow down with rapid movements in the GUI.

setting.name: Name for Home Screen
setting.description: The name that appears on the home screen for the plugin.

setting.name: Disk Insertion Behavior
setting.description: Action to take when a DVD, Bluray, or HDDVD disk is inserted. ("DETAILS": Goto the details page for the DVD. "PLAY": Start playback immediately. "NOTHING": Take no action).

setting.name: GUI Watch Percentage
setting.description: The percentage of a movie that must be watched before it will be flagged as watched. This also affects whether resume data is stored.

setting.name: Default Sort Field
setting.description: The default sort field used in the MediaPortal GUI when the plug-in is first opened. Valid options are "title", "dateadded", "year", "certification", "language", "score", "userscore", "popularity", "runtime", "filepath".

setting.name: Default Sort Direction
setting.description: The default sort direction used in the MediaPortal GUI when the plug-in is first opened. Valid options are "ascending" and "descending".

setting.name: Show Only Unwatched Movies on Startup
setting.description: When Moving Pictures starts up, if this option is set to true only Unwatched movies will be displayed until the user changes the filtering options.

setting.name: Enable Delete Movie
setting.description: Enables a delete menu item, which allows you to delete movies from your hard drive.

setting.name: Thread Count
setting.description: The number of threads retrieving move details for local media. A higher number uses more system resources, but can help with slow data providers. Do not set this value higher than 10 threads.

setting.name: Ignore Possible Matches with Incorrect Year
setting.description: If a year keyword is detected and no exact match is found only show the results from the same year or blank year. (experimental)

setting.name: Title Auto-Approve Threshold
setting.description: This is the maximum value for the levenshtein distance that is used for triggering auto-approval on close matching titles.

setting.name: Always Group Files In The Same Folder
setting.description: When enabled this option will ALWAYS group multiple files in one folder together (assuming a multi-part movie).

setting.name: Automatically Import Inserted DVDs
setting.description: Enables importation of media from all available optical drives. This can include CDs, DVDs, HD-DVDs, and Bluray disks. This also applies to "loose video files" on a data CD/DVD.

setting.name: Enable Importer While In GUI
setting.description: Enables the importer while in the GUI

setting.name: Prefer Folder Name for Movie Matching
setting.description: If a folder contains just one movie file it will use the folder name for matching. If you are sure that the filenames are more accurate than the folder name disable this setting.

setting.name: Regular Expression Noise Filter
setting.description: A regular expression that removes common used keywords from the folder/filename.

setting.name: Enable Disc ID
setting.description: Calculate Disc ID for DVD media. This enables better matching for DVD discs

setting.name: Enable Scanner
setting.description: Scan for NFO file and if available parse out the IMDB id.

setting.name: File Extensions
setting.description: The extensions that are used when scanning for nfo files. Seperate multiple extensions with , or ;

setting.name: Auto-Approve on IMDB Match
setting.description: If we found a match on IMDB id always auto-approve this match even if the other criteria doesn't match closely enough.

setting.name: Regular Expression String
setting.description: a regular expression that matches keywords in the filename indicating that the file is possible sample.

setting.name: Max Filesize (MB)
setting.description: If the filesize of the potential sample file is below this value it will be skipped.

setting.name: Cover Artwork Folder
setting.description: The folder in which cover art should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Cover Artwork Thumbnails Folder
setting.description: The folder in which cover art thumbnails should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Redownload Cover Artwork on Rescan
setting.description: When a full rescan is performed this setting determines if coverart that has already been downloaded will be reretrieved and the local copy updated.

setting.name: Max Covers per Movie
setting.description: When the movie importer automatically downloads cover art, it will not retrieve more than the given number of covers for a movie.

setting.name: Max Covers per Movie per Session
setting.description: When the movie importer automatically downloads cover art it will not retrieve more than the given number of covers for a movie in a single update / import session. Next time a full update is done, if there are additional covers to download, it will grab those as well.

setting.name: Minimum Cover Width
setting.description: The minimum width in pixels for any given cover. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Minimum Cover Height
setting.description: The minimum height in pixels for any given cover. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Backdrop Folder
setting.description: The folder in which movie backdrops should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Backdrop Thumbnails Folder
setting.description: The folder in which movie backdrop thumbnails should be saved to disk.

setting.name: Redownload Backdrop on Rescan
setting.description: When a full rescan is performed this setting determines if backdrops that have already been downloaded will be reretrieved and the local copy updated.

setting.name: Minimum Backdrop Width
setting.description: The minimum width in pixels for any given movie backdrop. If a backdrop from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not automatically be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Minimum Backdrop Height
setting.description: The minimum height in pixels for any given movie backdrop. If a cover from any data provider is smaller than this value it will not automatically be downloaded and saved.

setting.name: Max Timeouts
setting.description: The maximum number of timeouts received from the server before a thread returns an error condition.

setting.name: Timeout Length
setting.description: The base length of time (in milliseconds) for a timeout when connecting to themoviedb.org data service.

setting.name: Timeout Increment
setting.description: The amount of time (in milliseconds) added to the timeout limit after each timeout failure. A non-zero value will help when the server is experience a large amount of congestion.

setting.name: Backdrop Filename Pattern
setting.description: The importer will look in your backdrop folder and try to find a file that matches this pattern. If one is found, it will be used as a backdrop. If none is found, an online data provider will be used to auto download artwork.

setting.name: Search Movie Folder for Backdrops
setting.description: If set to true the local media data provider will use files matching a specified pattern for backdrops. This setting should only be used if you have all movies in their own folders.

setting.name: Movie Folder Backdrop Filename Pattern
setting.description: The importer will look in the folder the given movie was found in, and try to find a file that matches this pattern. If one is found, it will be used as a cover. DB field names can be used, surrounded by % symbols. e.g. %imdb_id%.jpg

setting.name: Cover Artwork Filename Pattern
setting.description: The importer will look in your cover art folder and try to find a file that matches this pattern. If one is found, it will be used as a cover. If none is found, an online data provider will be used to auto download artwork.

setting.name: Search Movie Folder for Cover Art
setting.description: If set to true the local media data provider will use files matching a specified pattern for cover artwork. This setting should only be used if you have all movies in their own folders.

setting.name: Movie Folder Cover Artwork Filename Pattern
setting.description: The importer will look in the folder the given movie was found in, and try to find a file that matches this pattern. If one is found, it will be used as a cover. DB field names can be used, surrounded by % symbols. e.g. %imdb_id%.jpg

setting.name: Data Source Manager Enhanced Debug Mode
setting.description: If set to true, additional logging will be written by the Scriptable Scraping Engine when the entire plug-in is in debug mode. Internal scripts stored in the DLL will also be reloaded on launch regardless of version number.

setting.name: Data Provider Manager Initialized
setting.description: An internal flag to determine if an initial load of the Data Source Manager has been preformed.

setting.name: Show Advanced Settings Warning
setting.description: If set to false, the Advanced Settings warning screen will no longer be displayed when first clicking on the Advanced Settings tab.

setting.name: Path to the Moving Pictures Help File
setting.description: The path to the Moving Pictures help file. For internal use only and reset on each launch.

setting.name: Custom Intro Location
setting.description: Location of a custom intro that will play before each movie. This should be the full path including the movie. For example: c:\custom_intro\into.mpg
